ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Good mid-to-advanced-level course on introductory statistical theory. Not directly applied or useful in any way, but good preparatory work for future econometrics or statistics courses.
I would recommend this course to other students because the material was interesting, well taught, and presented at a good pace.
If you're interested in basic econometric theory this course is useful.
Even if you think you have taken many Econometrics courses before, it's worth it to take Don Andrew's class.
Recommend. Great background for econometric studies.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Yes; will use methods in this course in research; though the theoretical parts of the course I won't use a much.
This course greatly improved my understanding of statistics.
Learned a great deal from this course. Even though the class was theoretical in nature, there were many examples and sections that were relevant for empirical econometrics.
I'm not sure how much of the material will be useful for people who are not doing theoretical work.
I thought I knew quite a few things about Econometrics before taking the course, but it turns out that I only knew the tip of the iceberg...
Gives good econometric theory background. Does not help yet with applied research.
